description.narrative: Kosovo Association of Information and Communication Technology, located at Rexhep Mala 28A, Prishtine 10000, represented by Enver Doko, President of the Board, acting as Contracting Partner of the United Entrepreneurship Coalition, hereafter referred to as “STIKK” or the “Partner”,

Output indicators: 1.1 3 trainings conducted 5 staff certified in Time Management 5 staff certified in Membership and Sales management 7 staff certified in Project Planning 2.1 285 (out of which 80 woman) trained potential/ existing entrepreneurship 13 companies given by consultancy 2.2 5 job fairs organized 15 (out of which 5 woman) internships 20 new members 2.3 12 Kosovo companies promoted 6 matchmaking accomplished 2.4 20 matchmaking accomplished 4 companies/start-ups participated 5 business leads created 2.5 5 companies participated 5 business leads generated 3 contracts signed 3.1 2 MOU signed with Academic Partners 4 Online/Media articles published 3.2 1 Desk Surveys 6 Interviews with relevant stakeholders 2 roundtables 3.3 1 Desk Surveys 4 Interviews with relevant stakeholders 4 roundtables with political parties 3.4 1 Desk Surveys 4 Interviews with relevant stakeholders 3 roundtable with academia, Ministry of Education and private sector 3.5 1 Desk Surveys 5 Interviews with relevant stakeholders 3 roundtable with students and new entrepreneurs
Project outcomes: 1. Increased capacity of STIKK staff by undergoing several training programs, 2. Increased number of companies that are exporting services and skilled workforce and increase membership base 3. STIKK becoming the industry advocacy and lobbing leader 4, Identification of obstacles and measures to be taken 5. Awareness raising of the decision makers regarding the establishment of the ICT Ministry 6. Awareness raising for engaging women in the ICT Sector 7. Awareness raising for the startup ecosystem that brings innovation and increases employment Outcome indicators: 1. 2 Enhanced STIKK services 2. 13 (out of which 4 by woman) SME Growth 18 (out of which 4 by woman) new jobs generated 3 % of membership value 3. 1 business barrier reduced 4. 1 business barrier reduced 5. 1 business barrier reduced 6. 1 business barrier reduced 7. 1 business barrier reduced

The Partner shares the vision of the Program: The consortium partners are united in their vision that pro-poor sustainable economic growth, particularly through (1) strengthening relevant local partners, (2) facilitating entrepreneurship; and (3) creating an enabling environment for private sector development, is essential for creating self-reliance and thereby poverty alleviation in least developed countries and fragile states. The United Entrepreneurship Coalition and its partners works towards this vision efficiently and effectively;
